abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for Community-Based Watershed
            Management (CBWM) Project for Mauritania were as follows:
            risk to global environment outcome was high, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: The positive impact of a project of this
            nature is the empowerment and ownership demonstrated as
            management plans are set up and local communities implement
            them. Important factors to consider in watershed management
            projects are the timing and manner of creating Associations
            de Bassins Versants (ABV). Sustainable Land Management (SLM)
            practices that make additional water available, such as the
            overflow dams and stone bunds developed through the CBWM
            Project, should be accompanied by agronomic advice to make
            the best use of the additional water. This type of project
            should be reevaluated five to ten years after it closes.

repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Community Based Watershed
            Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Community Based
            Watershed Management Project for Mauritania is to limit land
            degradation and to safeguard critical ecosystem functions
            through community-driven Sustainable Land Management (SLM)
            activities that improve agrosylvopastoral management and
            increase vegetation cover while securing livelihoods and
            global environmental benefits (i.e., reduced sedimentation
            of waterways, improved interconnectedness and integrity of
            ecosystems, enhanced carbon storage rates, and increased
            opportunities for biodiversity conservation). The extension
            is required to allow the Government to complete all project
            activities. This will in particular provide the time and
            resources to: (i) complete investments program by achieving
            a critical mass of actions necessary for the communities;
            (ii) allow time for technical support for at least one year
            to the Watershed Management Associations (ABV) benefitting
            from funding to implement their actions plans; and (iii) to
            enhance capacity of beneficiaries in monitoring,
            coordination of action and conflict management inherent in
            the implementation of management of local rules in natural
            resources to ensure the sustainability of achievements at
            the watershed level.

7293179.trustfund:
TF056782-GEF FSP-MAURITANIA:
            COMMUNITY-BASED WATERSHED MANAGEMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Community-Based Watershed Management
            Project for Mauritania will lessen the incidence of land
            degradation at the watershed level within the
            Community-Based Rural Development Project (CBRD) project
            area by assisting rural communities to generate benefits
            through community-driven investments addressing land
            degradation and promoting Sustainable Land Management (SLM)
            practices. The project consists of the following components:
            Component A: will support strengthening the capacity of
            community village associations and selected rural
            municipalities to design and implement effective development
            plans; developing the technical capacity of the
            communities' service providers. Component B: will
            provide the means to implement village and communal
            development plans while giving communities the opportunity
            to put into practice their strengthened capacities.
            Component C: the baseline will support general project
            management and coordination expenses, monitoring and
            evaluation, and the development and implementation of a
            communication strategy.

repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Community-Based Watershed
            Management Project : environmental and social management framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Community-Based
            Watershed Management Project for Mauritania is to lessen the
            incidence of land degradation at the watershed level within
            the project areas by assisting rural communities to realize
            the benefits through community-driven investments,
            addressing land degradation and promoting sustainable land
            management practices. Some of the environmental impacts
            include: soil degradation, water pollution, air pollution,
            noise nuisance, natural habitats, fauna and flora,
            communities, and health. Mitigating measures are in the
            areas of construction, material treatment, latrine
            implementation, vegetation, reforestation, measures to
            protect cultural heritage, transport material regulations,
            water management, and conflict resolution.
